headline: OpenAI’s New Sora Video Generator to Require Copyright Holders to Opt Out
summary: OpenAI is planning to release a new version of its Sora video generator that creates videos featuring copyright material unless copyright holders opt out of having their work appear, according to people familiar with the matter.  OpenAI began alerting talent agencies and studios about the forthcoming product and its opt-out process over the past week and plans to release the new version in the coming days, the people said.  The opt-out process for the new version of Sora means that movie studios and other intellectual property owners would have to explicitly ask OpenAI not to include their copyright material in videos the tool creates.

raw.headline: OpenAI’s New Sora Video Generator to Require Copyright Holders to Opt Out

The opt-out process for the new version of Sora means that movie studios and other intellectual property owners would have to explicitly ask OpenAI not to include their copyright material in videos the tool creates.

headline: Trump floats tariffs on furniture & movies, EA to go private
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top-moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including President Trump's proposed tariffs on furniture imports and movies made outside of the US and Electronic Arts (EA) going private via a buyout valued at up to $55 billion. headline: Imagine That: Xfinity's New Brand Platform Electrifies Imagination, and Frankenstein, With Unmatched Connectivity and Entertainment
summary: PHILADELPHIA, September 29, 2025--Comcast’s Xfinity has launched "Imagine That", a lasting brand platform designed to spark curiosity and inspire possibilities. "Imagine That" invites consumers into a world where technology fades into the background, working so seamlessly that life feels simpler, safer, and more extraordinary. Only Xfinity turns imagination into reality with its powerful connectivity and entertainment ecosystem.

headline: Comcast Names a Co-CEO. How the Stock Is Reacting.
summary: Comcast  said Monday that Michael Cavanagh would become its co-CEO alongside Brian Roberts, effective January 2026.  “He is the ideal person to help lead Comcast as we manage the pivot we are making to drive growth across the company,” Roberts, the NBCUniversal parent’s longtime CEO and chairman, said.  Cavanagh joined Comcast in 2015 and currently serves as its president.

Cavanagh joined Comcast in 2015 and currently serves as its president.

headline: Comcast Activates $4.8M All-New Fiber Internet Network in Havana, FL
summary: A new and powerful fiber Internet network is now online in parts of Havana, Florida, connecting communities to high-speed, reliable Internet. Thousands of homes and businesses in the area can now access Xfinity and Comcast Business services. Comcast invested $4.8 million to make this technology infrastructure project possible.

headline: Trump says US to impose 100% tariff on movies made outside the country
summary: (Reuters) -President Donald Trump said on Monday he would impose a 100% tariff on all films produced overseas that are then sent into the U.S., repeating a threat made in May that would upend Hollywood's global business model.  The step signals Trump's willingness to extend protectionist trade policies into cultural industries, raising uncertainty for studios that depend heavily on cross-border co-productions and international box-office revenue.  "Our movie making business has been stolen from the United States of America, by other Countries, just like stealing candy from a baby," Trump said in a post on his Truth Social.

raw.headline: Trump says US to impose 100% tariff on movies made outside the country
raw.summary: (Reuters) -President Donald Trump said on Monday he would impose a 100% tariff on all films produced overseas that are then sent into the U.S., repeating a threat made in May that would upend Hollywood's global business model.  The step signals Trump's willingness to extend protectionist trade policies into cultural industries, raising uncertainty for studios that depend heavily on cross-border co-productions and international box-office revenue.  "Our movie making business has been stolen from the United States of America, by other Countries, just like stealing candy from a baby," Trump said in a post on his Truth Social.

headline: Comcast names insider Michael Cavanagh as co-CEO ahead of cable spinoff
summary: Cavanagh will take up the new role in January and also join the company's board, serving alongside Brian Roberts, who will continue as chairman and co-CEO.  Comcast plans to spin off its NBCUniversal cable channels, including USA Network and CNBC, into a new company called Versant later this year amid shifting market dynamics and growing interest in streaming platforms.  "He is the ideal person to help lead Comcast as we manage the pivot we are making to drive growth across the company," Roberts said in a statement.

raw.headline: Comcast names insider Michael Cavanagh as co-CEO ahead of cable spinoff

Comcast plans to spin off its NBCUniversal cable channels, including USA Network and CNBC, into a new company called Versant later this year amid shifting market dynamics and growing interest in streaming platforms.  "He is the ideal person to help lead Comcast as we manage the pivot we are making to drive growth across the company," Roberts said in a statement.

headline: Comcast Corporation’s Mike Cavanagh to Join Brian Roberts as Co-Chief Executive Officer
summary: PHILADELPHIA, September 29, 2025--Comcast Corporation (Nasdaq: CMCSA) today announced that Michael J. Cavanagh has been named Co-Chief Executive Officer of the company, effective January 2026. He will serve alongside Brian L. Roberts, who will continue as Chairman and Co-CEO. Cavanagh will also be named to the Comcast Board of Directors at that time.

raw.headline: Comcast Corporation’s Mike Cavanagh to Join Brian Roberts as Co-Chief Executive Officer

Cavanagh has been named Co-Chief Executive Officer of the company, effective January 2026. He will serve alongside Brian L. Roberts, who will continue as Chairman and Co-CEO. Cavanagh will also be named to the Comcast Board of Directors at that time.

headline: Harmonic and Comcast Work Together to Expand Fiber Broadband Access
summary: Harmonic (NASDAQ: HLIT) and Comcast are joining forces to expand fiber broadband access as the Internet provider continues to expand its network into new markets. In 2024, Comcast expanded its network to more than one million new locations, with more than 1.2 million new locations planned by the end of 2025.
